translation: I got an invitation from "Zaojiu Talk" when I was at the Xichang Satellite Launch Center located at the remote area of the Daliang Mountains.
transcript: 在接到“造就”邀请函的时候，我正在大凉山的深处，在西昌卫星发射中心。

translation: The two BeiDou Navigation Satellites, developed by the navigational satellite research team of the Chinese Academy of Sciences.
transcript: 我们中科院导航卫星研制团队研制的这两颗北斗导航卫星。

translation: Fave been transferred to the launch zone under the protection of fairing.
transcript: 已经在整流罩的保护下转往发射区。

translation: Here's a photo I took with my phone.
transcript: 这是我在当时用手机拍摄的一张照片。

translation: The sky is unbelievably blue, isn't it?
transcript: 这个天空蓝得都不太像话。

translation: After being delivered to the launch zone, our satellites and the rocket stood still on the launch tower awaiting various inspections before the launch and the final firing command.
transcript: 那么在转入到发射区之后，我们的卫星呢就和火箭一起静静地矗立在发射塔上，在等待着临射前的各项检查和最后点火的一个指令。

translation: Eight days ago, at 7:18 in the morning of January 1st, China had the satellites launched in the way of an arrow binary.
transcript: 就在八天前，呃1月12号早上七点十八分，我们国家呢用一箭双星的方式成功地发射了这组北斗导航卫星。

translation: After three and a half hours of flight alongside with the upper stage, the satellites smoothly separated from the upper stage of the launcher at noon on that day.
transcript: 在卫星随着上面级分嗯飞行三个半小时之后，在当天中午，我们的卫星和运载上面级顺利地分离。

translation: And then the two satellites proceeded to go into their orbits.
transcript: 接下来的话呢，这两颗卫星就继续奔赴到它们既定的工作轨道上。

translation: Once the in-orbit test and the network verification are confirmed, the two satellites will provide services for our global users.
transcript: 在完成在轨测试和入网的验证之后，这两颗北斗导航卫星，将为我们全球的用户提供服务。

translation: Traditionally, we consider Beidou as the Big Dipper that comprises Dubhe, Merak, Phecda, Megrez, Alioth, Mizar and Alkaid.
transcript: 在我们的传统认知里，北斗是这样的，它是由天枢、天璇、天玑、天权、玉衡、开阳、瑶光。

translation: Our ancestors were truly imaginative in imagining the stars as a wine dipper.
transcript: 我们古代人很有想象力，他们把它想象成一个舀酒的斗型。

translation: Which we called Beidou.
transcript: 我们称它为北斗。

translation: We use the Big Dipper and the North Star to distinguish different seasons and determine our locations.
transcript: 那么利用北斗七星和北极星，我们来判断春夏秋冬，也来办辨别自己所处的位置。

translation: However, the Beidou I talk about today,
transcript: 那么在今天，我们所说的北斗是这样的。

translation: is China's Beidou Navigation System.
transcript: 这就是我们中国北斗卫星导航系统。

translation: Based on national security and economic and social demands, it's a global satellite navigation system developed and built on our own.
transcript: “北斗”呢是我们国家着眼于国家安全和经济社会需要，自主建设、独立研发的这样的一个全球卫星导航系统。

translation: The system includes space segment, i.e., the satellites, the ground segment and the users.
transcript: 它由空间段，也就是我们俗称的卫星，和地面段，还有用户。

translation: Actually, all of you are the users of Beidou.
transcript: 在座的各位其实都是北斗的用户，来组成的。

translation: It contains 3 geostationary earth orbit satellites, GEO satellite in short, 3 inclined geosynchronous orbit satellites, i.e., IGSO satellites, and 24 medium orbit earth satellites.
transcript: 它分为嗯有三颗地球静止轨道卫星，也就是GEO卫星，有三颗地球倾斜同步轨道卫星，也就是IGSO卫星，还有24颗地球中圆轨道卫星。

translation: As we know, China started to build the system in 1994.
transcript: 大家都知道，北斗卫星导航系统呢，是我们国家从1994年开始建设的。

translation: While the GPS of the United States and the GLONASS of Russia were initiated much earlier.
transcript: 但是呢在这个之前美国的GPS，俄罗斯的GLONASS啊都已经启动了它们的建设步伐。

translation: It is no exaggeration to say that a well-developed satellite navigation system best represents the country's comprehensive strength.
transcript: 应该说一个完善的卫星导航系统，其实是一个国家综合实力的一个最好的、最集中的展示。

translation: The United States continues to improve the accuracy and immunity of their GPS from interference, attack and utilization.
transcript: 美国呢还在持续地对GPS的精度，对它的抗干扰能力、抗攻击、反利用能力在持续地做工作。

translation: So as to sustain its dominance in the world.
transcript: 其实呢也是要试图地来保持它的在世界当中的一个霸主的地位。

translation: As for Russia.
transcript: 那么俄罗斯呢。

translation: By overcoming its domestic economic hardship.
transcript: 它是克服了国内的这个经济的经济上的困难。

translation: It has regained its autonomous control over GLONASS and will broaden the system's application.
transcript: 啊重新恢复这个自主控制GLONASS，也不断地推广它的应用。

translation: Well, the Beidou I am about to say is a system that partly takes the lead globally and shows Chinese characteristics.
transcript: 那么我们一会儿要说的这个北斗啊，是我们一个具有中国特色的局部领先的这样的一个系统。

translation: EU, the ally of the United States, is also developing its own system, GALILEO.
transcript: 那欧盟呢，作为美国的盟友，它也在发展自己的系统：伽利略系统。

translation: Apart from the global navigation systems.
transcript: 除了全球系统以外呢。

translation: Japan is establishing its Quasi-Zenith Satellite System, and India is working for its regional navigation satellite system.
transcript: 我们呢这个像日本，呃它也在建设它的准天顶系统，印度也都在建设它的区域卫星导航系统。

translation: In doing so, they try to develop their own navigation capacity.
transcript: 其实都是想要形成自己的导航的这样一个能力。

translation: Rome was not built in a day.
transcript: 嗯罗马不是一天建成的。

translation: So was Beidou. It also took a fairly long time to complete Beidou.
transcript: 那么北斗它的这个建设过程呢，其实也是非常漫长的。

translation: The year of 1994 marked its prototype.
transcript: 从1994年开始有这样的一个雏形开始。

translation: And in 2000, we took the first step, the BD-I was completed and put into operation.
transcript: 到2000年，我们的第一步也就是北斗一号建成使用。

translation: In terms of the second step, BD-II was composed of 14 satellites and more than 30 ground stations.
transcript: 第二步呢我们称它为北斗二号，北斗二号由14颗卫星组成，有30多个地面站。

translation: It was officially announced on December 27, 2012 that the BD-II started to offer the functions, such as positioning, velocity measurement, time service, with the accuracy of a decimeter level in Asia-Pacific region.
transcript: 这个的话呢是在2012年的12月27号正式地宣布向亚太地区提供十米级的这个定位、测速、授时等等功能。

translation: The BD-III, the real Beidou global navigation system, was initiated in 2009.
transcript: 我们的北斗三号，也就是我们真正意义上的北斗全球系统，这项工作的话呢，我们是从2009年开始启动。

translation: On November 5 last year, the first two satellites of the BD-III were launched.
transcript: 在去年的11月5号，发射了我们的第一组北斗三号双星。

translation: And just on January 12, the second pair was launched.
transcript: 在刚刚过去的1月12号发射了第二组。

translation: In 2018, we will carry out 9~10 times of intensive launch for 18 MEO satellites.
transcript: 在紧接着的今年18年里面，我们要完成九到十次高密度的发射，发射18颗MEO卫星。

translation: By then, we will be able to offer services to countries along the B&R.
transcript: 到时候呢我们就具备面向“一带一路”沿线国家提供服务的这样一个能力。

translation: In 2020, we plan to complete the launch and deployment of 35 satellites, which provide services for global users.
transcript: 在2020年，我们要完成全部的三十五颗卫星的发射和部署，具备向全球用户提供服务。

translation: After that, we will form a city of sky named "Beidou" in the space.
transcript: 通过这发射三十多颗卫星，我们就在空间织成了一座叫做“北斗”的天空之城。

translation: From BD-II to BD-III, there were numerous researchers who made extremely hard and strenuous effort.
transcript: 其实从北斗二号到北斗三号，里面有着数不清的科研工作人员为之付出了艰苦卓绝的努力。

translation: However, it is not only the number of satellites that has changed.
transcript: 但是我们不仅仅是卫星的数量从十几颗变到呃三十几颗，不仅仅是这样。

translation: what else has changed?
transcript: 那么它有哪些不一样的地方？

translation: First, its service need to be extended to the whole globe from regions.
transcript: 首先它的服务要从区域扩展到全球。

translation: Its aerospace capability need to be upgrade from regional scale to global scale.
transcript: 它的宇航能力要从一个局部实现全球的覆盖。

translation: In addition, it need to be compatible and interoperable with GPS, GLONASS and GALILEO.
transcript: 它还需要和GPS和GLONASS和伽利略兼容互操作。

translation: Second, compared with the BD-II, the accuracy has been substantially enhanced.
transcript: 同时的话呢，相比北斗二号，我们的精度呢也有大幅度的提升。

translation: From the accuracy of 10 m to 2.5~5 m for regional system.
transcript: 从区域系统的10米精度，我们提升到2.5米到5米。

translation: Actually, the BD-III I just mentioned is planned to secure in 5~6 years the improvement that took GPS more than 20 years.
transcript: 刚才说了这个北斗三号，其实呢我们是要用五六年的时间来跨越GPS二十多年走过的这样一个路程。

translation: So, what are the relevant work we have done?
transcript: 那么我们在哪些方面做出了相应的工作呢？

translation: First, the Beidou system is the first in the world to realize heterogeneous constellation.
transcript: 首先，我们北斗系统是在全球范围内的首次实现一个混合的异构的星座。

translation: Systems such as GPS and GALILEO are actually MEO satellites, while our Beidou system is a heterogeneous constellation composed of GEO satellites, IGSO satellites and MEO satellites.
transcript: 呃美国的GPS和欧洲的伽利略等等，它们其实都是呃地球中圆轨道的卫星，那么我们及北斗的话呢，它是有高轨卫星，就GEO的、有IGSO的、还有MEO的这样的一个混合星座。

translation: It realizes global coverage. Meanwhile, since some stationary positions are above our country, it can provide us with more accurate and higher-performance services.
transcript: 既能够实现全球的覆盖，同时由于有部分定点在我们国土上空的这样的卫星，能够为我们中国国土内提供更高精度、更好性能的这样一个服务。

translation: Besides, we've developed navigational signals with our own intellectual property.
transcript: 同时的话呢，我们还呃研发成功了我们自主知识产权的导航信号。

translation: Basically, the system functions by accepting its signals.
transcript: 其实我们收我们说北斗怎么提供服务的，就是接收它的信号。

translation: To put it in a simple way, we can now provide signals with higher quality in a shorter time.
transcript: 那么我们这个信号，简单来说就是同样的一个信号，我们可以在更短的时间里面提供更高质量的信号。

translation: So our users can enjoy faster and better positioning.
transcript: 这样的话呢，帮助我们的用户在更短时间内更快地、更好地定位。

translation: As we know, time is the basis of positioning.
transcript: 嗯大家都知道啊，那个时间是定位的基准。

translation: So the satellite-borne time and frequency are the basic indicators of our navigation satellite.
transcript: 那么星载的时频，其实就是我们导航卫星的最根本的一个指标。

translation: The BD-III is equipped with hydrogen maser clock and rubidium clock with higher accuracy.
transcript: 我们的北斗三号卫星呢，配备了更高精度的氢原子钟和铷原子钟。

translation: We know that a mechanical watch works with errors. It may deviate from the real time by one second per day.
transcript: 我们大家都知道，我们的机械表它是有误差的，嗯每一天的话呢它可能会偏差一秒。

translation: Well, a quartz watch may be better, 0.1 second per day.
transcript: 那么我们的石英表可能好一点，那么每一天呢偏差在0.1秒。

translation: But the deviation of the rubidium clock on our satellites is ten times ten to the negative fourteenth power second per 10,000 seconds, while that of the hydrogen maser clock is even smaller.
transcript: 但是我们星上配置的这个铷原子钟，它每一万秒的偏差在十乘以十十乘以负十四次方，氢原子钟呢精度更高。

translation: Ten times ten to the negative fifteenth power second per 10,000 seconds.
transcript: 它的万秒的偏差在十乘以十的负十五次方秒。

translation: In other words, the clocks on the satellites produce a deviation of one second in 3 million years to 10 million years.
transcript: 换算一下的话，就是我们星上配置的这个钟，它在每三百万年到一千万年才偏差一秒。

translation: There is no exaggeration to call them the strongest brain.
transcript: 称它为最强大脑不过最强心脏不过分吧！

translation: It is due to such highly precise atomic clocks that our satellites can provide more accurate positioning and better signals.
transcript: 那么正是因为配置了这样的高精度的原子钟，我们的北斗导航卫星才能够提供更高精度的这个定位、更好的信号。

translation: Well, just like our body, apart from a strong heart.
transcript: 嗯就像一个人体一样啊，我们需要有一个很强的心脏。

translation: We also need unobstructed main and collateral channels.
transcript: 那么我们也需要有非常畅通的咱们的这个经络。

translation: A traditional satellite navigation system includes three parts, as I said before, the space segment, ground segment and the user segment.
transcript: 那么对于传统的这个几呃一个卫星导航系统来讲，我刚才说了它是由三部分组成，空间段、地面段、还有我们的用户段。

translation: An in-orbit satellite is not a loose kite. It has interactions with the ground.
transcript: 那么卫星它在天上，它其实不是一个呃失去联系的风筝，它其实跟地面它是有互动的。

translation: We often send some data to the satellite from the ground stations to correct its deviations so that the entire system can be stabilized for long.
transcript: 我们地面要随时地向卫星上注一些数据，呃纠正它的一些偏差等等的，这样的话呢来确保整个系统是长期稳定地运行的。

translation: The GPS has plenty of ground stations in the world to ensure its global service.
transcript: 那么GPS呢就在全球范围内部署了很多地面站，啊来构建它的这样一个全球系统。

translation: As we extend the Beidou to the entire world, we encountered the first obstacle in the way, that is, how to build overseas stations.
transcript: 那么在我们的北斗从区域往全球走的这个过程当中，我们一上来碰到的第一个拦路虎，其实就是如何去海外建站。

translation: It is seemingly inextricable in the short term to tackle such problems such as long-period construction and difficulties in international coordination.
transcript: 在海外建站周期长、国际上的协调难度大等等，似乎是我们一个短期内不能攻克的这样一个难关。

translation: However, our researchers diverted their attention to the space.
transcript: 那么我们的科研人员这个时候，他就把自己从地面把眼光放到了空中。

translation: It's uneasy to set up stations in other countries.
transcript: 我既然我不能够很容易地在其他国土上建设地面站。

translation: So why don't we transfer the function of those stations onto the satellites?
transcript: 那么我们为什么不把这项工作放到卫星上去做呢？

translation: So we built inter-satellite links.
transcript: 这就是我们北斗导航卫星的星间链路。

translation: In a nutshell, it's to open a channel between satellites to connect all of them.
transcript: 简单来讲，其实就是通过在我们的卫星和卫星之间打通一条通道，让卫星和卫星之间能够星看星、手拉手。

translation: And our Beidou is capable of building a link as long as 50,000~70,000 km.
transcript: 那么我们的北斗导航卫星，它能够实现五万到七万公里之间这样的一个链路的建立。

translation: In this room, we can see each other and have eye contact. But an in-orbit satellite, about two meters high, is 50,000~70,000 km away from another one in the vast space.
transcript: 其实今天跟大家在一块儿，我们可以有眼神的交流，我们甚至互相看得到对方，但是对于一颗卫星，它可能就两米多高，在浩瀚的宇宙，两颗星在各自的轨道上，它们相距五万到七万公里。

translation: Under such a circumstance, they are two specks of dust.
transcript: 在这种情况下，它们就是两颗尘埃。

translation: But our inter-satellite link technology made it come true.
transcript: 但是我们北斗的星间链路技术就实现了。

translation: So the two specks of dust can capture, lock and send signals within 100 milliseconds.
transcript: 这样的两颗尘埃它们在一百毫秒的这个时间里面能够相互捕获、锁定并且发送信号。

translation: In this way, they can often interchange information of time and orbit.
transcript: 它们可以经常交互这个时间的信息，嗯交互轨道的信息。

translation: Without the ground support, our Beidou system, a constellation based on inter-satellite links, can maintain its autonomous operation through mutual calibration in a certain period.
transcript: 当地面，我们失去地面这个支持的时候，我们这个呃北斗的这样一个基于星间链路的这样一个星座，它们能够在一段时间内呃通过互相的一个校准校准来维持自己的自主运行。

translation: That's the ability of autonomous navigation I am about to say.
transcript: 这就是我们将来要说的自主导航的能力。

translation: Of course, the system forms a network, which leaves plenty space for imagination.
transcript: 当然啦，我们北斗通过星间链路织成了一张网，这张网其实也给我们提提供了很多想象的空间。

translation: In the near future, our Tiangong space station will also be fitted with such facilities, which will form an even bigger network in the space.
transcript: 在不远的将来，我们的天宫、我们的空间站是都会配置这样的设备，到时候呢它们就能够在天上组成一个更大的网络。

translation: I have no idea how many IT engineers are present today, but they know it's impossible to fix all the bugs of software.
transcript: 今天嗯来现场的不知道有多少IT的工作人员啊，我们经常说做软件的呢都知道Bug是修不完的。

translation: It's also applicable to the satellite research and manufacturing.
transcript: 其实这呃这句话呢，也同样适用于我们卫星研制的这个行业。

translation: When we undertook the task, the deadline was set.
transcript: 因为从我们拿到任务开始，它的后墙就是不倒的。

translation: So we were not so assured that the satellites were perfect and would not malfunction in the space.
transcript: 那么在有限的时间内我们很难去拍胸脯说，我们所有的问题都出完了，我们到天上不会再出问题了。

translation: No, we were not.
transcript: 做不到。

translation: Normally, after a satellite is launched, its functions cannot be changed anymore.
transcript: 那么常规的做法就是当卫星发射开始，它那个时候功能是什么样的，它就是什么样儿的。

translation: But what if something goes wrong after the satellite is sent in the orbit?
transcript: 假设它在轨出现问题了怎么办？

translation: Sorry, there is nothing we can do, because what has been done cannot be undone.
transcript: 对不起，没有办法，可能只能干瞪眼，因为生米已经煮成熟饭了。

translation: However, our Beidou system realizes in-orbit reconfiguration.
transcript: 但是呢，在我们北斗卫星上我们实现了在轨重构的功能。

translation: What does in-orbit reconfiguration mean?
transcript: 在轨重构意味着什么呢？

translation: Except for firmware, others such as CPU, DSP and FPGA can be reconfigured.
transcript: 除了固件以外啊，其他的像CPU、DSP、FPGA我都能够在轨重构。

translation: Every time when some new problems appear in the space, we can upload a new version to the satellites.
transcript: 当我们可能有卫星到天上去之后又暴露出一些新的问题，我可以通过将一个一个新的版本上注到天上去之后。

translation: So the satellites upgrade its system and patch its faults.
transcript: 然后呢它来完成它系统的升级，也等于是给自己不断地打下补丁。

translation: So, this is the case when there are faults.
transcript: 当然这是有错是改错。

translation: But when there are not, and our users have some new requirements, do we have to send another satellite into the space?
transcript: 如果没有错，那假设我们的用户对我们提出了新的要求，我是不是要重新再发射一颗卫星上去呢？

translation: With in-orbit reconfiguration, we don't have to.
transcript: 有了这个功能就可以做到。

translation: We can get the new function realized, fully tested and verified on the ground, and then upload it to the satellites, just like installing a new APP on our satellites.
transcript: 我们可以把这个新的功能在地面上实现了、测试充分了、验证了，通过这种方式上载上去，就相当于给我们的卫星也装载了一个新的APP。

translation: Now, we all have smart phones, which give us endless imagination.
transcript: 现在我们大家都有很多的智能手机，我们可以有无限的想象空间。

translation: That is the in-orbit empowerment of our software.
transcript: 这就是我们软件的在轨赋能。

translation: As I said before, the establishment of Beidou attributes to myriads of people's dedication.
transcript: 刚才和大家说了，北斗的建设呢是凝聚了千千万万人的心血。

translation: And I didn't even realize that we are in 2018 now.
transcript: 我刚才都没有意识到现在已经是2018了。

translation: On June 16, 2016, the State Council Information Office held a news conference to publish the white paper China's BeiDou Navigation Satellite System, confirming our goal to establish Beidou.
transcript: 在2016年的6月16号，我们国务院新闻办公室开了一个发布会，向全世界公布了我们中国北斗卫星导航系统这份白皮书，也明确了我们北斗的建设步伐。

translation: It includes our plan to launch 18 MEO satellites in 2018 and the remaining 17 satellites by the end of 2020 to provide global services.
transcript: 当时就说要在2018年发射18颗MEO卫星，在2020年我们要完成全部的35颗卫星的发射，向全球用户提供服务。

translation: At that time, I thought the plan was far ahead, but now, we have rung in the year of 2018.
transcript: 当时我们觉得这是多么遥远的一件事情，可是呢2018已经来了。

translation: On the basis of our Beidou system in the space and the ground-based augmentation system.
transcript: 基于我们在天上的这样的一个北斗系统，再加上我们北斗地基增强系统。

translation: We are able to increase the positioning accuracy to a centimeter level in regions, and a decimeter level in China and a meter level in the world.
transcript: 我们能够实现区域的厘米级定位精度、全国范围内的分米级定位精度和全球范围内的米级定位精度。

translation: Let me give you an example.
transcript: 有了这样的一个基础。

translation: On this picture, if the red line is our planned route, the traditional navigation, which is represented by the yellow line, often shows a path out of the road.
transcript: 这张背景这个图哈，红色的比方说是我们本来既定的一个路线，但是呢我们传统的导航经常会导着导着黄颜色的会把我们往水沟里导。

translation: But such cases won't happen in the future, for we will have higher-accuracy positioning.
transcript: 但是呢将来这个情况就不会再发生，我们会实现更高精度的这个定位。

translation: China is an ancient country boasting a long history and agricultural civilization.
transcript: 啊我们中国呢是一个有着非常悠久历史的，有着农耕文化的这样的一个古国哈。

translation: Our ancestors worked for thousands of years from sunrise to sunset every day.
transcript: 我们几千年以来日出而作，日落而息。

translation: However, with a vast territory and abundant resources as well as complicated landform.
transcript: 但是呢由于我们国家幅员辽阔，这个地形地貌呢也都非常复杂。

translation: It is hard to get agriculture modernized in our country.
transcript: 我们很难去实现这个这个农业的这个现代化。

translation: Its automation level is far behind the western developed countries.
transcript: 它的这个自动化的水平啊和西方发达国家呢，也都有比较大的差距。

translation: But as the Beidou system is established and gradually put into use, precision agriculture might be possible.
transcript: 但是随着我们北斗系统的建成，越来越多地投入使用，那么我们的精准农业呢也将成为可能。

translation: There's an image for you to imagine.
transcript: 还有一个画面大家可以畅想一下。

translation: At daytime, the streets are loaded with endless stream of people and vehicles.
transcript: 白天啊道路上这个川流不息的人群、车辆。

translation: At night, the streets are trodden by couriers that never need to get off work.
transcript: 但到了晚上之后那些不用下班的快递小哥，他们也忙碌在这个马路上。

translation: Owing to our Beidou system, driverless vehicles carrying our parcels work day in and day out.
transcript: 一辆一辆无人配送的车辆，基于我们北斗系统它能够昼夜不息地在工作。

translation: So we may wake up in the morning to see our parcels lie before us.
transcript: 也许以后等我们早上醒过来，各种各样的包裹就已经出现在我们的面前了。

translation: Beidou, the city of sky, changes our life.
transcript: 北斗呢，这样的一座天空之城啊，它改变了我们的生活。

translation: Simply speaking, it improves our traffic conditions, our experience and our lifestyles.
transcript: 简单说它改善了我们的交通状况，将会改善我们的体验，也改变我们的这个种种生活方式。

translation: From the legends of Chang E and Wan Hu to the ongoing Mars exploration program, humans have never given up their exploration of the universe in thousands of years.
transcript: 从神话传说里面的嫦娥奔月到万户飞天，到现在已经在实施的火星探测计划，嗯人类几千年以来啊，从来没有放弃过对宇宙的探索。

translation: Here's an ad.
transcript: 做个广告。

translation: This is the Micius, a quantum space satellite developed by the institute I work for.
transcript: 这是我们单位前段时间研制的“墨子号”量子科学实验卫星。

translation: And this is the Wukong, our dark matter particle explorer.
transcript: 这是我们研制的“悟空号”暗物质粒子探测卫星。

translation: Humans never ceased to explore the universe in the past, so will they in the future.
transcript: 人类探索宇宙的脚步从来没有停止过，可以想象这个脚步也不会停止。

translation: All of this being said, the Beidou, while providing positioning, time service and navigation to our near-earth users.
transcript: 那么，我们的北斗它在提供为我们的地球近地用户提供定位、授时、导航服务的同时。

translation: Also serves as a space infrastructure of great significance for us humans to explore the unfathomable ocean of stars.
transcript: 这样的一座空一一个非常重要的空间基础设施，它也必然为我们人类走向更远的星辰大海提供一个梦想的天梯。

translation: Thank you!
transcript: 谢谢！
